The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:
Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)
...or something like this:
The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.
As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Arena
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" el_class="stm-dark-bg" css=".vc_custom_1464847439864{margin-bottom: 63px !important;padding-top: 46px !important;padding-bottom: 54px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_images_grid button_type="secondary" button_color_style="style-4" title="The multi-purpose 60,000 seat Perth Stadium will be a world-class venue" images="1048,1048,1048,1048"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1462864548372{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462863733611{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

STADIUM KEY FANS FIRST FEATURES

[/vc_column_text][stm_icon_list list_type="font" title="fa fa-arrow-right"]
  •  Future-proofed stadium technology will be provided, including full 4G Wi-Fi coverage across the Stadium and Sports Precinct.
  • Two 240m² giant video screens are some of the largest in Australia and will use the latest technology when the Stadium opens in 2018.
  • Over 1,000 TV screens are strategically located throughout the interior of the Stadium so fans never miss the action.
  • A Children’s Activity Zone within the Stadium.
  • Fans will be able to utilise more than 70 food and beverage outlets and still be able to view the action on the field.
  • A buffet and a la carte restaurant over-looking the Swan River provide a destination for patrons both pre and post‑game plus on non-event days.
  • The Stadium will include the widest range of seating and hospitality options of any stadia in Australia.
  • Cup holders are included in every seat and seats themselves will be a minimum of 50cm wide, maximising comfort for fans.
[/stm_icon_list][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462188948406{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 53px !important;padding-bottom: 47px !important;background-color: #000000 !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1461760085996{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462189366608{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

item.content:encoded:
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.
FC Barcelona locks up Satoransky through 2020
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). OI think the results were dominant, but we had spurts of dominance in a lot of games,” said USA coach Mike Krzyzewski (Duke University). “And, we had tough games, and then FIBA World Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World

2015 NBA CHAMPIONSHIPS

[/vc_column_text][stm_slider images="1048,1048,1048,1048"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1463052531447{margin-top: 71px !important;}"]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" item.title: 2016 Offseason Preview
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.
FC Barcelona locks up Satoransky through 2020
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). OI think the results were dominant, but we had spurts of dominance in a lot of games,” said USA coach Mike Krzyzewski (Duke University). “And, we had tough games, and then FIBA World Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
ONE THIRD OF OLYMPICS REFEREES FROM EUROLEAGUE BASKETBALL

Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.
FC Barcelona locks up Satoransky through 2020
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). OI think the results were dominant, but we had spurts of dominance in a lot of games,” said USA coach Mike Krzyzewski (Duke University). “And, we had tough games, and then FIBA World Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World
item.excerpt:encoded: After 20 months, it is still too early to grade James' 2014 decision to leave the Heat and return to Ohio habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus

item.title: Our history
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]
USA Fires Its Way To World Cup Gold
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). OI think the results were dominant, but we had spurts of dominance in a lot of games,” said USA coach Mike Krzyzewski (Duke University). “And, we had tough games, and then FIBA World[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces" css=".vc_custom_1462444563407{background-color: #fafaf8 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_reviews_carousel][/vc_column][/vc_row]

ABOUT CLUB

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462444694699{margin-bottom: 30px !important;}"]
USA FIRES ITS WAY TO WORLD CUP GOLD
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Arena
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" el_class="stm-red-bg" css=".vc_custom_1462863483762{margin-bottom: 50px !important;padding-top: 50px !important;padding-bottom: 50px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_images_grid button_type="secondary" button_color_style="style-4" title="The multi-purpose 60,000 seat Perth Stadium will be a world-class venue" images="327,313,312,311,310,309,314,321,475,117,435,94,95,97,436,437,438,432,431,430,429,428,427"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

STADIUM KEY FANS FIRST FEATURES

[/vc_column_text][stm_icon_list list_type="font" title="fa fa-arrow-right"]
  •  Future-proofed stadium technology will be provided, including full 4G Wi-Fi coverage across the Stadium and Sports Precinct.
  • Two 240m² giant video screens are some of the largest in Australia and will use the latest technology when the Stadium opens in 2018.
  • Over 1,000 TV screens are strategically located throughout the interior of the Stadium so fans never miss the action.
  • A Children’s Activity Zone within the Stadium.
  • Fans will be able to utilise more than 70 food and beverage outlets and still be able to view the action on the field.
  • A buffet and a la carte restaurant over-looking the Swan River provide a destination for patrons both pre and post‑game plus on non-event days.
  • The Stadium will include the widest range of seating and hospitality options of any stadia in Australia.
  • Cup holders are included in every seat and seats themselves will be a minimum of 50cm wide, maximising comfort for fans.
[/stm_icon_list][/vc_column][/vc_row]

The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1462863779440{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462863733611{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

STADIUM KEY FANS FIRST FEATURES

[/vc_column_text][stm_icon_list list_type="font" title="fa fa-arrow-right"]
  •  Future-proofed stadium technology will be provided, including full 4G Wi-Fi coverage across the Stadium and Sports Precinct.
  • Two 240m² giant video screens are some of the largest in Australia and will use the latest technology when the Stadium opens in 2018.
  • Over 1,000 TV screens are strategically located throughout the interior of the Stadium so fans never miss the action.
  • A Children’s Activity Zone within the Stadium.
  • Fans will be able to utilise more than 70 food and beverage outlets and still be able to view the action on the field.
  • A buffet and a la carte restaurant over-looking the Swan River provide a destination for patrons both pre and post‑game plus on non-event days.
  • The Stadium will include the widest range of seating and hospitality options of any stadia in Australia.
  • Cup holders are included in every seat and seats themselves will be a minimum of 50cm wide, maximising comfort for fans.
[/stm_icon_list][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text] [/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462188948406{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 53px !important;padding-bottom: 47px !important;background-color: #000000 !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1461760085996{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462189366608{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

Сheck out our Instagram profile and follow us for bursts of inspiration

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces" css=".vc_custom_1461759659379{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1461759927650{padding-top: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1461759701676{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"][instagram-feed][/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Arena
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" el_class="stm-red-bg" css=".vc_custom_1462864405924{margin-bottom: 63px !important;padding-top: 46px !important;padding-bottom: 54px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_images_grid button_type="secondary" button_color_style="style-4" title="The multi-purpose 60,000 seat Perth Stadium will be a world-class venue" images="327,313,312,311,310,309,314,321,475,117,435,94,95,97,436,437,438,432,431,430,429,428,427"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1462864548372{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462863733611{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

STADIUM KEY FANS FIRST FEATURES

[/vc_column_text][stm_icon_list list_type="font" title="fa fa-arrow-right"]
  •  Future-proofed stadium technology will be provided, including full 4G Wi-Fi coverage across the Stadium and Sports Precinct.
  • Two 240m² giant video screens are some of the largest in Australia and will use the latest technology when the Stadium opens in 2018.
  • Over 1,000 TV screens are strategically located throughout the interior of the Stadium so fans never miss the action.
  • A Children’s Activity Zone within the Stadium.
  • Fans will be able to utilise more than 70 food and beverage outlets and still be able to view the action on the field.
  • A buffet and a la carte restaurant over-looking the Swan River provide a destination for patrons both pre and post‑game plus on non-event days.
  • The Stadium will include the widest range of seating and hospitality options of any stadia in Australia.
  • Cup holders are included in every seat and seats themselves will be a minimum of 50cm wide, maximising comfort for fans.
[/stm_icon_list][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462188948406{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 53px !important;padding-bottom: 47px !important;background-color: #000000 !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1461760085996{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462189366608{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

item.title: Trophy room
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="2/3"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="728" img_size="216x424" css_animation="bottom-to-top"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Trophy room
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="2/3"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="728" img_size="216x424" css_animation="bottom-to-top"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][stm_team_history feature="%5B%7B%22year%22%3A%222016%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Canada%20participates%20in%20the%20first%20Pan%20American%20Games%20in%20Winnipeg%2C%20Manitoba%22%2C%22content%22%3A%22Lorem%20ipsum%20dolor%20sit%20amet%2C%20consectetur%20adipiscing%20elit.%20Sed%20gravida%20tempus%20tincidunt.%20Nulla%20blandit%20lacinia%20feugiat.%20Sed%20egestas%20blandit%20nisl%20id%20laoreet.%20Nunc%20bibendum%20dui%20in%20diam%20tristique%20pretium.%20Nunc%20ullamcorper%20auctor%20metus.%20Sed%20rutrum%2C%20risus%20sed%20hendrerit%20volutpat%2C%20est%20ligula%20blandit%20ipsum%2C%20sit%20amet%20vulputate%20justo%20risus%20in%20massa.%20Donec%20eu%20lorem%20sed%20diam%20venenatis%20tristique%20dictum%20ac%20lorem.%20Cras%20turpis%20turpis%2C%20pretium%20nec%20aliquet%20nec%2C%20dignissim%20quis%20erat.%22%7D%2C%7B%22year%22%3A%222013%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22The%20Canadian%20Men%E2%80%99s%20National%20Team%20is%20named%20the%20Team%20of%20the%20Year%22%2C%22content%22%3A%22Lorem%20ipsum%20dolor%20sit%20amet%2C%20consectetur%20adipiscing%20elit.%20Sed%20gravida%20tempus%20tincidunt.%20Nulla%20blandit%20lacinia%20feugiat.%20Sed%20egestas%20blandit%20nisl%20id%20laoreet.%20Nunc%20bibendum%20dui%20in%20diam%20tristique%20pretium.%20Nunc%20ullamcorper%20auctor%20metus.%20Sed%20rutrum%2C%20risus%20sed%20hendrerit%20volutpat%2C%20est%20ligula%20blandit%20ipsum%2C%20sit%20amet%20vulputate%20justo%20risus%20in%20massa.%20Donec%20eu%20lorem%20sed%20diam%20venenatis%20tristique%20dictum%20ac%20lorem.%20Cras%20turpis%20turpis%2C%20pretium%20nec%20aliquet%20nec%2C%20dignissim%20quis%20erat.%22%7D%2C%7B%22year%22%3A%222008%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Canada%20successfully%20hosts%20the%20Women%E2%80%99s%20World%20Championship%20in%20Toronto%2C%20Ontario%22%2C%22content%22%3A%22Lorem%20ipsum%20dolor%20sit%20amet%2C%20consectetur%20adipiscing%20elit.%20Sed%20gravida%20tempus%20tincidunt.%20Nulla%20blandit%20lacinia%20feugiat.%20Sed%20egestas%20blandit%20nisl%20id%20laoreet.%20Nunc%20bibendum%20dui%20in%20diam%20tristique%20pretium.%20Nunc%20ullamcorper%20auctor%20metus.%20Sed%20rutrum%2C%20risus%20sed%20hendrerit%20volutpat%2C%20est%20ligula%20blandit%20ipsum%2C%20sit%20amet%20vulputate%20justo%20risus%20in%20massa.%20Donec%20eu%20lorem%20sed%20diam%20venenatis%20tristique%20dictum%20ac%20lorem.%20Cras%20turpis%20turpis%2C%20pretium%20nec%20aliquet%20nec%2C%20dignissim%20quis%20erat.%22%7D%2C%7B%22year%22%3A%222002%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22The%20Canadian%20Men%E2%80%99s%20National%20Team%20is%20named%20the%20Team%20of%20the%20Year%22%2C%22content%22%3A%22Lorem%20ipsum%20dolor%20sit%20amet%2C%20consectetur%20adipiscing%20elit.%20Sed%20gravida%20tempus%20tincidunt.%20Nulla%20blandit%20lacinia%20feugiat.%20Sed%20egestas%20blandit%20nisl%20id%20laoreet.%20Nunc%20bibendum%20dui%20in%20diam%20tristique%20pretium.%20Nunc%20ullamcorper%20auctor%20metus.%20Sed%20rutrum%2C%20risus%20sed%20hendrerit%20volutpat%2C%20est%20ligula%20blandit%20ipsum%2C%20sit%20amet%20vulputate%20justo%20risus%20in%20massa.%20Donec%20eu%20lorem%20sed%20diam%20venenatis%20tristique%20dictum%20ac%20lorem.%20Cras%20turpis%20turpis%2C%20pretium%20nec%20aliquet%20nec%2C%20dignissim%20quis%20erat.%22%7D%5D"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Trophy room

item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="2/3"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="728" [vc_row][vc_column width="2/3"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_single_image image="728" img_size="216x424" css_animation="bottom-to-top" css=".vc_custom_1462959759256{margin-top: -153px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462959961770{padding-top: 40px !important;padding-bottom: 15px !important;background-color: #f0f0f0 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_team_history The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

[vc_row][vc_column width="2/3"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" offset="vc_hidden-sm vc_hidden-xs"][vc_single_image image="728" img_size="216x424" css_animation="bottom-to-top" css=".vc_custom_1462959759256{margin-top: -153px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row %20tristique%20pretium.%20Nunc%20ullamcorper%20auctor%20metus.%20Sed%20rutrum%2C%20risus%20sed%20hendrerit%20volutpat%2C%20est%20ligula%20blandit%20ipsum%2C%20sit%20amet%20vulputate%20justo%20risus%20in%20massa.%20Donec%20eu%20lorem%20sed%20diam%20venenatis%20tristique%20dictum%20ac%20lorem.%20Cras%20turpis%20turpis%2C%20pretium%20nec%20aliquet%20nec%2C%20dignissim%20quis%20erat.%22%7D%2C%7B%22year%22%3A%222002%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22The%20Canadian%20Men%E2%80%99s%20National%20Team%20is%20named%20the%20Team%20of%20the%20Year%22%2C%22content%22%3A%22Lorem%20ipsum%20dolor%20sit%20amet%2C%20consectetur%20adipiscing%20elit.%20Sed%20gravida%20tempus%20tincidunt.%20Nulla%20blandit%20lacinia%20feugiat.%20Sed%20egestas%20blandit%20nisl%20id%20laoreet.%20Nunc%20bibendum%20dui%20in%20diam%20tristique%20pretium.%20Nunc%20ullamcorper%20auctor%20metus.%20Sed%20rutrum%2C%20risus%20sed%20hendrerit%20volutpat%2C%20est%20ligula%20blandit%20ipsum%2C%20sit%20amet%20vulputate%20justo%20risus%20in%20massa.%20Donec%20eu%20lorem%20sed%20diam%20venenatis%20tristique%20dictum%20ac%20lorem.%20Cras%20turpis%20turpis%2C%20pretium%20nec%20aliquet%20nec%2C%20dignissim%20quis%20erat.%22%7D%5D"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]

2015 NBA CHAMPIONSHIPS

[/vc_column_text][stm_slider images="753,475"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462535085472{padding-top: 10px !important;padding-bottom: 38px !important;background-color: #f0f0f0 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_trophies][stm_trophy images="309" image="621" year="2015" title="UEFA CHAMPIONS LEAGUE "][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][stm_trophy images="309" image="624" year="2013" title="BUNDESLIGA CHAMPION CUP"][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][/stm_trophies][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462188948406{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 53px !important;padding-bottom: 47px !important;background-color: #000000 !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1461760085996{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462189366608{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-8"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" offset="vc_hidden-md vc_hidden-sm 2015 NBA CHAMPIONSHIPS

[/vc_column_text][stm_slider images="753,475"][vc_column_text el_class="stm-opacity-8"]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462535085472{padding-top: 10px !important;padding-bottom: 38px !important;background-color: #f0f0f0 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_trophies][stm_trophy images="309" image="621" year="2015" title="UEFA CHAMPIONS LEAGUE "][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][stm_trophy images="309" image="624" year="2013" title="BUNDESLIGA CHAMPION CUP"][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][/stm_trophies][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462188948406{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 53px !important;padding-bottom: 47px !important;background-color: #000000 !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1461760085996{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462189366608{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462530955535{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 43px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column width="1/4" css=".vc_custom_1462531425199{margin-top: 7px !important;padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_wp_custommenu nav_menu="45"][/vc_column][vc_column width="3/4" css=".vc_custom_1462531430496{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462530849785{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}"]

ABOUT CLUB

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462530868641{margin-bottom: 28px !important;}"]
USA FIRES ITS WAY TO WORLD CUP GOLD
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). OI think the results were dominant, but we had spurts of dominance in a lot of games,” said USA coach Mike Krzyzewski (Duke University). “And, we had tough games, and then FIBA World[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row_content_no_spaces" css=".vc_custom_1462444563407{background-color: #fafaf8 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_reviews_carousel][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462535085472{padding-top: 10px !important;padding-bottom: 38px !important;background-color: #f0f0f0 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_trophies][stm_trophy images="309" image="621" year="2015" title="UEFA CHAMPIONS LEAGUE "][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][stm_trophy images="309" image="624" year="2013" title="BUNDESLIGA CHAMPION CUP"][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][stm_trophy images="309" image="625" year="2012" title="MLS League Cup"][/stm_trophies][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462535182317{padding-top: 26px !important;padding-bottom: 107px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column][stm_carousel image_size="full" title="Our sponsors" images="669,660,661,666,665,664,663,670"][/vc_column][/vc_row]

2015 NBA CHAMPIONSHIPS

The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

2015 NBA CHAMPIONSHIPS

[/vc_column_text][stm_slider images="753,117"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and [vc_row][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="794" img_size="full" css_animation="left-to-right" css=".vc_custom_1463050730423{margin-bottom: 60px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1463050768171{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]
Basketball's First Dynasty (1997-2002)
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="stm-opacity-8" css=".vc_custom_1463051023300{margin-bottom: 31px !important;}"]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="792" img_size="full" css_animation="left-to-right" css=".vc_custom_1463051358169{margin-bottom: 59px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1463051380117{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]
Basketball's First Dynasty (1997-2002)
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="stm-opacity-8"]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive  tournament  FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_column_text el_class="stm-opacity-8" css=".vc_custom_1463051204135{margin-top: 6px !important;margin-bottom: 67px !important;}"]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive. y 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive. y 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="793" img_size="full" css_animation="right-to-left" css=".vc_custom_1463051061262{margin-bottom: 81px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1463051088058{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]
Basketball's First Dynasty (1997-2002)
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="stm-opacity-8" css=".vc_custom_1463051409875{margin-bottom: 59px !important;}"]James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][vc_single_image image="791" img_size="full" css_animation="right-to-left"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1463051547727{padding-top: 15px !important;padding-bottom: 15px !important;background-color: #151515 !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]

2015 NBA CHAMPIONSHIPS

[/vc_column_text][stm_slider images="753,117"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1463051986009{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 28px !important;padding-bottom: 28px !important;background-color: #f0f0f0 !important;}"][vc_column][stm_team_history feature="%5B%7B%22year%22%3A%222016%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Canada%20participates%20in%20the%20first%20Pan%20American%20Games%20in%20Winnipeg%2C%20Manitoba%22%2C%22content%22%3A%22Lorem%20ipsum%20dolor%20sit%20amet%2C%20consectetur%20adipiscing%20elit.%20Sed%20gravida%20tempus%20tincidunt.%20Nulla%20blandit%20lacinia%20feugiat.%20Sed%20egestas%20blandit%20nisl%20id%20laoreet.%20Nunc%20bibendum%20dui%20in%20diam%20tristique%20pretium.%20Nunc%20ullamcorper%20auctor%20metus.%20Sed%20rutrum%2C%20risus%20sed%20hendrerit%20volutpat%2C%20est%20ligula%20blandit%20ipsum%2C%20sit%20amet%20vulputate%20justo%20risus%20in%20massa.%20Donec%20eu%20lorem%20sed%20diam%20venenatis%20tristique%20dictum%20ac%20lorem.%20Cras%20turpis%20turpis%2C%20pretium%20nec%20aliquet%20nec%2C%20dignissim%20quis%20erat.%22%7D%2C%7B%22year%22%3A%222013%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22The%20Canadian%20Men%E2%80%99s%20National%20Team%20is%20named%20the%20Team%20of%20the%20Year%22%2C%22content%22%3A%22Lorem%20ipsum%20dolor%20sit%20amet%2C%20consectetur%20adipiscing%20elit.%20Sed%20gravida%20tempus%20tincidunt.%20Nulla%20blandit%20lacinia%20feugiat.%20Sed%20egestas%20blandit%20nisl%20id%20laoreet.%20Nunc%20bibendum%20dui%20in%20diam%20tristique%20pretium.%20Nunc%20ullamcorper%20auctor%20metus.%20Sed%20rutrum%2C%20risus%20sed%20hendrerit%20volutpat%2C%20est%20ligula%20blandit%20ipsum%2C%20sit%20amet%20vulputate%20justo%20risus%20in%20massa.%20Donec%20eu%20lorem%20sed%20diam%20venenatis%20tristique%20dictum%20ac%20lorem.%20Cras%20turpis%20turpis%2C%20pretium%20nec%20aliquet%20nec%2C%20dignissim%20quis%20erat.%22%7D%2C%7B%22year%22%3A%222008%22%2C%22title%22%3A%22Canada%20successfully%20hosts%20the%20Women%E2%80%99s%20World%20Championship%20in%20Toronto%2C%20Ontario%22%2C%22content%22%3A%22Lorem%20ipsum%20dolor%20sit%20amet%2C%20consectetur%20adipiscing%20elit.%20Sed%20gravida%20tempus%20tincidunt.%20Nulla%20blandit%20lacinia%20feugiat.%20Sed%20egestas%20blandit%20nisl%20id%20laoreet.%20Nunc%20bibendum%20dui%20in%20diam item.title: Mario Bellucci
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1463634398632{padding-top: 20px !important;padding-bottom: 40px !important;background: #000000 url(http://basketball.stylemixthemes.com/wp-content/uploads/1988/04/player-bg.jpg?id=834) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text]

BIOGRAPHY

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Was not drafted in the 2006 NBA Draft ... Signed with the Sacramento Kings on July 8, 2006...Waived by the Kings on October 26, 2006 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Utah Jazz on February 5, 2007 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Philadelphia 76ers on March 8, 2007 and then signed for the remainder of the season ... Signed as a free agent with the Phoenix Suns on March 8, 2007 ... Signed as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on September 13, 2010 ... Acquired by the Indiana Pacers from Golden STate in exchange for Brandon Rush just before start of training camp in 2011...Signed by the Wolves as an unrestricted free agent on Sept. 25, 2012 2011-12 HIGHLIGHTS WITH INDIANA: Acquired by the Pacers from Golden State in exchange for Brandon Rush just before the start of training camp... Though he averaged just 3.7 rebounds per game and logged an average of 12.6 minutes per contest, he was fourth on the team with 94 offensive rebounds and was third with 44 blocked shots...Gathered four or more rebounds 29 times and claimed 10+ rebounds twice... Had a season-high with12 boards at Charlotte, 2/22, grabbing a season-high six offensive boards in that game... Including acareer-best nine rebounds at the defensive end, totaled 10 at New Orleans, 3/3... Added 11 points inthat game against the Hornets for his only double-double of the campaign. 2010-11 HIGHLIGHTS WITH GOLDEN STATE: Appeared in 46 games (seven starts), averaging 4.3 points and 4.0 rebounds in a career-high 15.0 minutes pre game...scoring and rebounding averages were the second highest marks of his career...Logged 20 or more minutes 10 times in the season, averagint 5.7 rebounds int hose contests...Gathered in a season-high 12 rebounds at New Orleans on 1/5, scored a season-high 11 points twice: vs. Lakers 4/6 and vs. Timberwolves on 3/13. 2009-10 HIGHLIGHTS WITH PHOENIX: Appeared in 79 games, averaging 4.7 points and 4.4 rebounds in 14.8 minutes while shooting 55.1% from the field … Set new career-highs in nearly every major statistical category, including points, rebounds, field goal percentage and minutes … Played 20-plus minutes 14 times, averaging 9.1 points, 6.9 rebounds, 2.14 blocks and 22.1 minutes in those contests … Scored 10-plus points 11 times … Scored a career-high tying 20 points vs. Minnesota (3/16) … Grabbed 10-plus rebounds four times … Registered two double-doubles, both of the point/rebound variety … Appeared in all 16 of the Suns playoff games, averaging 2.9 points and 3.5 rebounds in 12.1 minutes. Was not drafted in the 2006 NBA Draft ... Signed with the Sacramento Kings on July 8, 2006...Waived by the Kings on October 26, 2006 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Utah Jazz on February 5, 2007 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Philadelphia 76ers on March 8, 2007 and then signed for the remainder of the season ... Signed as a free agent with the Phoenix Suns on March 8, 2007 ... Signed as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on September 13, 2010 ... Acquired by the Indiana Pacers from Golden STate in exchange for Brandon Rush just before start of training camp in 2011...Signed by the Wolves as an unrestricted free agent on Sept. 25, 2012[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: About Club
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1465451839647{margin-top: -53px !important;margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-bottom: 43px !important;background-color: #ffffff !important;}"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1462531430496{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1465451877832{margin-bottom: 40px !important;}"]

ABOUT CLUB

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1465452031822{margin-bottom: 23px !important;}"]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1465452048891{margin-bottom: 25px !important;}"]
Spilled sensationally that sanctimoniously gawked dear misheard inside including bridled caustic carelessly climbed. Spilled sensationally that wherever ducked flagrantly squinted tarantala including bridled caustic
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1465452073726{margin-bottom: 44px !important;}"]Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1465452099088{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]
USA FIRES ITS WAY TO WORLD CUP GOLD
[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text]Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2"][vc_single_image image="898" img_size="full" onclick="link_image" css=".vc_custom_1465452181953{margin-top: 48px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1465452188084{margin-bottom: 22px !important;}"]

item.title: Arena
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" el_class="stm-dark-bg" css=".vc_custom_1464847439864{margin-bottom: 63px !important;padding-top: 46px !important;padding-bottom: 54px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_images_grid button_type="secondary" button_color_style="style-4" title="The multi-purpose 60,000 seat Perth Stadium will be a world-class venue" images="327,313,312,311,310,309,314,321,475,117,435,94,95,97,436,437,438,432,431,430,429,428,427"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1462864548372{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462863733611{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

STADIUM KEY FANS FIRST FEATURES

[/vc_column_text][stm_icon_list list_type="font" title="fa fa-arrow-right"]
  •  Future-proofed stadium technology will be provided, including full 4G Wi-Fi coverage across the Stadium and Sports Precinct.
  • Two 240m² giant video screens are some of the largest in Australia and will use the latest technology when the Stadium opens in 2018.
  • Over 1,000 TV screens are strategically located throughout the interior of the Stadium so fans never miss the action.
  • A Children’s Activity Zone within the Stadium.
  • Fans will be able to utilise more than 70 food and beverage outlets and still be able to view the action on the field.
  • A buffet and a la carte restaurant over-looking the Swan River provide a destination for patrons both pre and post‑game plus on non-event days.
  • The Stadium will include the widest range of seating and hospitality options of any stadia in Australia.
  • Cup holders are included in every seat and seats themselves will be a minimum of 50cm wide, maximising comfort for fans.
[/stm_icon_list][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462188948406{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 53px !important;padding-bottom: 47px !important;background-color: #000000 !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1461760085996{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462189366608{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

Сheck out our Instagram profile and follow us for bursts of inspiration

The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.
FC Barcelona locks up Satoransky through 2020
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). OI think the results were dominant, but we had spurts of dominance in a lot of games,” said USA coach Mike Krzyzewski (Duke University). “And, we had tough games, and then FIBA World Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World

The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1465452099088{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

item.title: Aiden Leggatt
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1463640038752{margin-bottom: 12px !important;padding-top: 31px !important;padding-bottom: 65px !important;background: #000000 url(http://basketball.stylemixthemes.com/wp-content/uploads/1988/04/player-bg.jpg?id=834) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1463639904653{margin-bottom: 28px !important;}"]

BIOGRAPHY

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="stm-font-size-14"]Was not drafted in the 2006 NBA Draft ... Signed with the Sacramento Kings on July 8, 2006...Waived by the Kings on October 26, 2006 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Utah Jazz on February 5, 2007 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Philadelphia 76ers on March 8, 2007 and then signed for the remainder of the season ... Signed as a free agent with the Phoenix Suns on March 8, 2007 ... Signed as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on September 13, 2010 ... Acquired by the Indiana Pacers from Golden STate in exchange for Brandon Rush just before start of training camp in 2011...Signed by the Wolves as an unrestricted free agent on Sept. 25, 2012 2011-12 HIGHLIGHTS WITH INDIANA: Acquired by the Pacers from Golden State in exchange for Brandon Rush just before the start of training camp... Though he averaged just 3.7 rebounds per game and logged an average of 12.6 minutes per contest, he was fourth on the team with 94 offensive rebounds and was third with 44 blocked shots...Gathered four or more rebounds 29 times and claimed 10+ rebounds twice... Had a season-high with12 boards at Charlotte, 2/22, grabbing a season-high six offensive boards in that game... Including acareer-best nine rebounds at the defensive end, totaled 10 at New Orleans, 3/3... Added 11 points inthat game against the Hornets for his only double-double of the campaign. 2010-11 HIGHLIGHTS WITH GOLDEN STATE: Appeared in 46 games (seven starts), averaging 4.3 points and 4.0 rebounds in a career-high 15.0 minutes pre game...scoring and rebounding averages were the second highest marks of his career...Logged 20 or more minutes 10 times in the season, averagint 5.7 rebounds int hose contests...Gathered in a season-high 12 rebounds at New Orleans on 1/5, scored a season-high 11 points twice: vs. Lakers 4/6 and vs. Timberwolves on 3/13. 2009-10 HIGHLIGHTS WITH PHOENIX: Appeared in 79 games, averaging 4.7 points and 4.4 rebounds in 14.8 minutes while shooting 55.1% from the field … Set new career-highs in nearly every major statistical category, including points, rebounds, field goal percentage and minutes … Played 20-plus minutes 14 times, averaging 9.1 points, 6.9 rebounds, 2.14 blocks and 22.1 minutes in those contests … Scored 10-plus points 11 times … Scored a career-high tying 20 points vs. Minnesota (3/16) … Grabbed 10-plus rebounds four times … Registered two double-doubles, both of the point/rebound variety … Appeared in all 16 of the Suns playoff games, averaging 2.9 points and 3.5 rebounds in 12.1 minutes. Was not drafted in the 2006 NBA Draft ... Signed with the Sacramento Kings on July 8, 2006...Waived by the Kings on October 26, 2006 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Utah Jazz on February 5, 2007 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Philadelphia 76ers on March 8, 2007 and then signed for the remainder of the season ... Signed as a free agent with the Phoenix Suns on March 8, 2007 ... Signed as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on September 13, 2010 ... Acquired by the Indiana Pacers from Golden STate in exchange for Brandon Rush just before start of training camp in 2011...Signed by the Wolves as an unrestricted free agent on Sept. 25, 2012[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Mitchell Childe
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1463640038752{margin-bottom: 12px !important;padding-top: 31px !important;padding-bottom: 65px !important;background: #000000 url(http://basketball.stylemixthemes.com/wp-content/uploads/1988/04/player-bg.jpg?id=834) !important;background-position: center !important;background-repeat: no-repeat !important;background-size: cover !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1463639904653{margin-bottom: 28px !important;}"]

BIOGRAPHY

[/vc_column_text][vc_column_text el_class="stm-font-size-14"]Was not drafted in the 2006 NBA Draft ... Signed with the Sacramento Kings on July 8, 2006...Waived by the Kings on October 26, 2006 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Utah Jazz on February 5, 2007 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Philadelphia 76ers on March 8, 2007 and then signed for the remainder of the season ... Signed as a free agent with the Phoenix Suns on March 8, 2007 ... Signed as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on September 13, 2010 ... Acquired by the Indiana Pacers from Golden STate in exchange for Brandon Rush just before start of training camp in 2011...Signed by the Wolves as an unrestricted free agent on Sept. 25, 2012 2011-12 HIGHLIGHTS WITH INDIANA: Acquired by the Pacers from Golden State in exchange for Brandon Rush just before the start of training camp... Though he averaged just 3.7 rebounds per game and logged an average of 12.6 minutes per contest, he was fourth on the team with 94 offensive rebounds and was third with 44 blocked shots...Gathered four or more rebounds 29 times and claimed 10+ rebounds twice... Had a season-high with12 boards at Charlotte, 2/22, grabbing a season-high six offensive boards in that game... Including acareer-best nine rebounds at the defensive end, totaled 10 at New Orleans, 3/3... Added 11 points inthat game against the Hornets for his only double-double of the campaign. 2010-11 HIGHLIGHTS WITH GOLDEN STATE: Appeared in 46 games (seven starts), averaging 4.3 points and 4.0 rebounds in a career-high 15.0 minutes pre game...scoring and rebounding averages were the second highest marks of his career...Logged 20 or more minutes 10 times in the season, averagint 5.7 rebounds int hose contests...Gathered in a season-high 12 rebounds at New Orleans on 1/5, scored a season-high 11 points twice: vs. Lakers 4/6 and vs. Timberwolves on 3/13. 2009-10 HIGHLIGHTS WITH PHOENIX: Appeared in 79 games, averaging 4.7 points and 4.4 rebounds in 14.8 minutes while shooting 55.1% from the field … Set new career-highs in nearly every major statistical category, including points, rebounds, field goal percentage and minutes … Played 20-plus minutes 14 times, averaging 9.1 points, 6.9 rebounds, 2.14 blocks and 22.1 minutes in those contests … Scored 10-plus points 11 times … Scored a career-high tying 20 points vs. Minnesota (3/16) … Grabbed 10-plus rebounds four times … Registered two double-doubles, both of the point/rebound variety … Appeared in all 16 of the Suns playoff games, averaging 2.9 points and 3.5 rebounds in 12.1 minutes. Was not drafted in the 2006 NBA Draft ... Signed with the Sacramento Kings on July 8, 2006...Waived by the Kings on October 26, 2006 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Utah Jazz on February 5, 2007 ... Signed the first of two 10-day contracts with the Philadelphia 76ers on March 8, 2007 and then signed for the remainder of the season ... Signed as a free agent with the Phoenix Suns on March 8, 2007 ... Signed as a free agent with the Golden State Warriors on September 13, 2010 ... Acquired by the Indiana Pacers from Golden STate in exchange for Brandon Rush just before start of training camp in 2011...Signed by the Wolves as an unrestricted free agent on Sept. 25, 2012[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]

item.title: Game 5: 24 Second Thoughts
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.
FC Barcelona locks up Satoransky through 2020
Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games. The USA’s +33.0 points per game differential was the most of a U.S. men’s team in a FIBA World Cup or Olympic Games since the 1994 World Championship (+37.8). OI think the results were dominant, but we had spurts of dominance in a lot of games,” said USA coach Mike Krzyzewski (Duke University). “And, we had tough games, and then FIBA World Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World
item.excerpt:encoded: After 20 months, it is still too early to grade James' 2014 decision to leave the Heat and return to Ohio habitant morbi tristique senectus et netus

item.title: Arena
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row full_width="stretch_row" el_class="stm-dark-bg" css=".vc_custom_1464847439864{margin-bottom: 63px !important;padding-top: 46px !important;padding-bottom: 54px !important;}"][vc_column][stm_images_grid button_type="secondary" button_color_style="style-4" title="The multi-purpose 60,000 seat Perth Stadium will be a world-class venue" images="981,982,972,984,891,983,985,986,753,732,898,690"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css=".vc_custom_1462864548372{margin-bottom: 35px !important;}"][vc_column][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462863733611{margin-bottom: 20px !important;}"]

STADIUM KEY FANS FIRST FEATURES

[/vc_column_text][stm_icon_list list_type="font" title="fa fa-arrow-right"]
  •  Future-proofed stadium technology will be provided, including full 4G Wi-Fi coverage across the Stadium and Sports Precinct.
  • Two 240m² giant video screens are some of the largest in Australia and will use the latest technology when the Stadium opens in 2018.
  • Over 1,000 TV screens are strategically located throughout the interior of the Stadium so fans never miss the action.
  • A Children’s Activity Zone within the Stadium.
  • Fans will be able to utilise more than 70 food and beverage outlets and still be able to view the action on the field.
  • A buffet and a la carte restaurant over-looking the Swan River provide a destination for patrons both pre and post‑game plus on non-event days.
  • The Stadium will include the widest range of seating and hospitality options of any stadia in Australia.
  • Cup holders are included in every seat and seats themselves will be a minimum of 50cm wide, maximising comfort for fans.
[/stm_icon_list][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" css=".vc_custom_1462188948406{margin-bottom: 0px !important;padding-top: 53px !important;padding-bottom: 47px !important;background-color: #000000 !important;}"][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1461760085996{padding-top: 0px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1462189366608{margin-bottom: 0px !important;}"]

item.title: Our history
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:

[vc_row][vc_column offset="vc_col-lg-8"][vc_column_text]Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive Led by 26 points from tournament MVP Kyrie Irving (Cleveland Cavaliers) and 23 points from James Harden (Houston Rockets), the USA (9-0) saved its best performance of the World Cup for the gold medal clash as the Americans captured a second-consecutive FIBA World Cup gold medal with a blistering 129-92 win over Serbia (5-4) at the Palacio de os Deportes de la Comunidad arena on Sunday night in Madrid, Spain. The USA, which distanced itself from Serbia early in the game with a 28-6 run to close the first quarter, became just the third country in FIBA World Cup history to capture consecutive titles, and more crucial, the championship earned the USA an automatic bid into the 2016 Rio de Janeiro Olympic Games.[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3" offset="vc_hidden-md vc_hidden-sm
